div.p: Unit 4, VPRS 780 inward correspondence, Melbourne Observatory, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 25.10.93. To proof.
MS stamped: 'OBSERVATORY MELBOURNE 20 NOV 84'.
Many thanks for Baron Von Mueller's letter. I have not written to thank him yet because the book he promises has not come to hand.
Does Sydney Observatory correspondence survive?
I do not see how I am to find his report in the Argus
follow up.
But I have found an abstract of it in the English Mechanic
follow up.
and the meaning conveyed to the writer is very different from what the Baron says, and "Marsh" who is quoted on all hands, as a great authority on Forrests and Rain, says distinctly " on [...] soils he Baron von Müller has created [...] more than a hundred points, forests and water courses " and I am very anxious to have more particulars of these incipient Rivers, no doubt it is all right, but it is too important to pass without notice, many of my friends want rivers on their stations and if a few trees of any kind will bring the river they will make the trees grow at any price no need for a Department of Forrests they will find all the work done in a year without cost if it will only bring the Rivers
